intro: Ardisia albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the summer. Ardisia albiflora is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate floral display. It prefers shaded, moist environments and is relatively easy to care for in suitable conditions.
